result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clemonte S Massey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clemonte S Massey appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Clemonte S Massey.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. TAD evaluation has been completed. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Clemonte S Massey appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clemonte S Massey appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Clemonte S Massey.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery. Case may be in DPA posture. TAD evaluation needs to be completed. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Clemonte S Massey in court.  Thomas L. Potter, along with student intern Madaline Witte under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@2pm
